metadata.title: CVE-2016-1236 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in (1) revision.php,(2) log.php, (3) listing.php, and (4) comp.php in WebSVN allowcontext-dependent attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via thename of a (a) file or (b) directory in a repository.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1236` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

websvn - 2.3.3-1.1+deb7u3build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: websvn package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.3-1.1+deb7u3build0.14.04.1').
